description: Technical assessment challenges for different programming languages and difficulties

challenges.title: Fix the Hello World
challenges.brokenCode:
# Fix the code to print 'Hello, World!'
print('Hello World)
challenges.hint: Check for missing closing quote and the comma after 'Hello'

challenges.title: Fix Variable Assignment
challenges.brokenCode:
# Fix the code to calculate and print the sum
x = 5
y == 10
print(x + y)
challenges.hint: Assignment uses '=' not '=='. The '==' operator is for comparison.

challenges.title: Fix the Loop
challenges.hint: Missing colon after the for loop and range should go to 6 to include 5

challenges.title: Fix List Indexing
challenges.brokenCode:
# Fix the code to print the first element
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']
print(fruits[1])
challenges.hint: Lists in Python are zero-indexed. First element is at index 0.

challenges.title: Fix Function Definition
challenges.brokenCode:
# Fix the function to calculate square of a number
define square(n):
    result = n * n
    return result

print(square(5))
challenges.hint: Python uses 'def' keyword, not 'define' to define functions

challenges.title: Fix Dictionary Access
challenges.hint: Dictionaries use square brackets [] for key access, not parentheses ()

challenges.title: Fix List Comprehension
challenges.brokenCode:
# Fix the code to create a list of even numbers from 0 to 10
evens = [x for x in range(11) if x % 2 = 0]
print(evens)
challenges.hint: Use '==' for comparison, not '=' in the if condition

challenges.title: Fix String Formatting
challenges.brokenCode:
# Fix the code to print formatted string
name = 'Bob'
age = 30
print(f'My name is {name and I am {age} years old')
challenges.correctOutput: My name is Bob and I am 30 years old
challenges.hint: Missing closing brace for {name}. Each variable needs its own {braces}

challenges.title: Fix Recursive Function
challenges.hint: Use '==' for comparison in if statement, and handle n == 0 case

challenges.title: Fix Class Definition
challenges.hint: Instance methods need 'self' as the first parameter

challenges.title: Fix Java Hello World
challenges.hint: Missing semicolon at the end of the println statement

challenges.title: Fix Variable Declaration
challenges.hint: Missing semicolon after the println statement

challenges.title: Fix Array Access
challenges.hint: Arrays are zero-indexed. Index 5 is out of bounds for an array of size 5

challenges.title: Fix Method Return Type
challenges.hint: Method that returns a value should have proper return type (int), not void

challenges.title: Fix JavaScript Variable
challenges.brokenCode:
// Fix the code to print the sum
let x = 5
let y = 10
console.log(x + y)
challenges.hint: Missing semicolons after variable declarations (optional in JS but good practice)

challenges.title: Fix Arrow Function
challenges.hint: Arrow functions use '=>' not just '>'

challenges.title: Fix Array Method
challenges.hint: The code is almost correct, just add semicolon for consistency

challenges.title: Fix Object Destructuring
challenges.hint: Objects use curly braces {} for destructuring, not square brackets []

challenges.title: Fix SELECT Statement
challenges.brokenCode:
-- Fix the query to select all columns from users table
SELECT FROM users;
challenges.hint: Use * to select all columns: SELECT * FROM table_name

challenges.title: Fix WHERE Clause
challenges.brokenCode:
-- Fix the query to get users with age greater than 18
SELECT * FROM users WHERE age = 18;
challenges.hint: Use '>' operator for 'greater than', not '=' which checks equality
